EmailTemplate.subject: Weekly News Update 6th September, 2012
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear Parents,
With the new academic year now two weeks young, we now have some interesting information outlined below for your information!!!
We are pleased to offer you continued opportunities to develop links within our community in the coming weeks.
1. Meet The Teacher Evenings 2012
Please can we make a final reminder to all parents that we will be holding our annual met the teacher evenings next week.
These evenings present an important opportunity to achieve the following:
- To establish strong positive relationships and lines of communication between home and school.
- To share key phase specific information not already included in our Parent/Student Handbook and curriculum letters.
- To offer you an opportunity to visit the classroom environment and meet our teaching teams.
- To understand how you can play a positive and active role in our school.
The timings are as follows:
The Lower Campus evening (From Nursery up to Year 3) will take place on Tuesday September 11th. (5:30 start- please arrive promptly as presentations will begin at this time)
The Upper Campus evening (From Year 4 to Year 10) will take place on Thursday September 13th. (5:30 start- please arrive promptly as presentations will begin at this time)
The meetings will take place in their tutor’s classroom. If you are unsure of the location please arrive early so that we can guide you to the location before the meetings begin.
We look forward to seeing you next week!
2. Coffee Mornings:
Attention: Lower School Parents;
As we come to the end of the second week back at school and students, teachers and new families are settling in their new environments, please be reminded of the coffee mornings that will take place next week.
It is a casual get together where you will be able to catch up with old friends, meet new ones, have a chat with the Headmaster, and if they are not teaching, get to know the phase leaders of you child/ren year groups.
Please find below the dates for the different year groups.
Monday, 10th September 8:30 - 9:30 – N Tuesday, 11th Septemebr 8:30 – 9:30 – R Wednesday, 12th September 8:30 – 9:30 – Y1 Thursday, 13th September 8:30 – 9:30 – Y2 Friday, 14th September 8:30 – 9:30 – Y3
We look forward to seeing you all there!
3. Instrumental Music :
Instrumental lessons 2012-2013
Please click here to download the information and request form to enable your child to begin one to one instrumental tuition which is offered on various instruments here at ISM. All completed forms with payment need to be returned to Reception or the finance office by Thursday 13th September. Instrumental tuition will commence week beginning 17/09/2012.
Choirs and Ensembles (Begin week beginning 17th September)
Regardless of whether you child chooses to do instrumental tuition in school or not all students will also be very welcome to come along to one of the Music departments choirs and ensembles which run at lunchtimes during the school week. Tuesday - Senior Choir (Years 6-10) Thursday - Orchestra (Years 6- 10) Friday - String Ensemble. (Years 4 and 5) Choirs for Years 1-3 and 4 & 5 will be offered through the After school activities program.
Please do not hesitate to contact me should you have any questions.
James Langford
Best Regards
